attributes.comment:
I am writing on behalf of my husband and myself in reference to the proposed
USCIS fee changes that are proposed to occur in mid-2007.

We are in the midst of compiling our paperwork to adopt from China. We think it is
unfair and unreasonable that due to the extended wait that is imposed by the
Chinese government (waiting for our child match), that we would be penalized by
paying higher fees to re-file our I-600A paperwork with the USCIS. We are
disappionted that the government would charge us fee's again, much less that
they would be higher than what we paid before for our original paperwork.

We ask that the government offer a waiver to families that are currently waiting for
a child match, and that they would extend the deadline OR not impose the higher
fee's should our I-171H expire prior to child match. Thank you for your
consideration.

Renee Gardenhire
Black Diamond, WA
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Renee Gardenhire
